meanings.definition: A highly toxic carbamate pesticide used to control insects and mites.
meanings.sent1: Farmers use aldicarb to protect their crops from harmful bugs.
meanings.sent2: The aldicarb application effectively reduced the pest population in the fields.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous insects avoided the aldicarb-treated area, knowing it was trouble.
meanings.sent4: The aldicarb worked like a shield, keeping the plants safe from tiny invaders.
meanings.sent5: The bright red warning label on the aldicarb container signaled danger to all who saw it.

meanings.definition: A chemical compound with the formula C7H14N2O2S.
meanings.sent1: Scientists studied the structure of aldicarb to understand its properties better.
meanings.sent2: The lab technician carefully measured the aldicarb compound for the experiment.
meanings.sent3: In the chemistry lab, the students marveled at the complexity of aldicarb's formula.
meanings.sent4: The unique composition of aldicarb made it stand out among other chemicals.
meanings.sent5: Under the microscope, the aldicarb crystals sparkled like tiny gems.
